articles.headline: Trump Says He Would Have Rushed in Unarmed to Stop School Shooting
articles.snippet: President Trump said the United States needs to consider opening more mental health institutions to avert mass shootings, and he castigated the Florida police response.
articles.abstract: President Trump said the United States needs to consider opening more mental health institutions to avert mass shootings, and he castigated the Florida police response.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump asserted Monday that he would have rushed in to save the students and teachers of Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School from a gunman with an assault weapon, even if he was unarmed at the time of the massacre.

articles.headline: Trump’s Tax Cuts in Hand, Companies Spend More on Themselves Than on Wages
articles.snippet: The maneuver is good for companies’ stock prices, but it may not help the overall economy — undercutting a central goal of the tax cuts.
articles.abstract: The maneuver is good for companies’ stock prices, but it may not help the overall economy — undercutting a central goal of the tax cuts.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Trump promised that his tax cut would encourage companies to invest in factories, workers and wages, setting off a spending spree that would reinvigorate the American economy.

articles.headline: How a Deal to Sell the Weinstein Company Fell Apart
articles.snippet: On Feb. 10, it seemed that a sale involving the Weinstein Company was on the verge of being completed. It has since collapsed, and the finger-pointing has begun.
articles.abstract: On Feb. 10, it seemed that a sale involving the Weinstein Company was on the verge of being completed. It has since collapsed, and the finger-pointing has begun.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Two weeks ago, the embattled Weinstein Company looked like it had finally found a way forward.

articles.headline: Billy Graham Warned Against Embracing a President. His Son Has Gone Another Way.
articles.snippet: Evangelicals like Franklin Graham are locked in a tight embrace with the president and the Republican Party. Some are now asking if the movement has gone astray.
articles.abstract: Evangelicals like Franklin Graham are locked in a tight embrace with the president and the Republican Party. Some are now asking if the movement has gone astray.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Rev. Billy Graham admitted in his later years that he had learned a hard lesson after the Watergate scandal exposed his cozy complicity with President Richard M. Nixon: Pastors should not become too enmeshed with politicians and partisan politics.

articles.headline: Italy Is Having an Election. Most Italians Are Too Depressed to Care.
articles.snippet: Despite improvements, Italy’s economy remains moribund for millions of working people — a source of contempt about approaching national elections.
articles.abstract: Despite improvements, Italy’s economy remains moribund for millions of working people — a source of contempt about approaching national elections.
articles.lead_paragraph: TARANTO, Italy — Like millions of young Italians, Elio Vagali confronts career options that range from minimal to nonexistent. At 29, he has cleaned homes, picked tangerines and lifted rocks — nearly always off the books, without the protections of a full-time contract.

articles.headline: Comcast Seeks Control of Broadcaster Sky, Countering Murdoch and Disney
articles.snippet: The offer, which values the British satellite broadcaster at $31 billion, could derail 21st Century Fox’s long efforts to acquire full control of it.
articles.abstract: The offer, which values the British satellite broadcaster at $31 billion, could derail 21st Century Fox’s long efforts to acquire full control of it.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Comcast may have found a way to disrupt Walt Disney Company’s plan to buy most of 21st Century Fox: topping Fox’s bid to buy the British satellite broadcaster Sky with its own $31 billion takeover offer.
articles.byline: By Chad Bray and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: U.N. Links North Korea to Syria’s Chemical Weapons Program
articles.snippet: An unreleased report says North Korea has evaded United Nations sanctions, providing Syria with materials for chemical weapons.
articles.abstract: An unreleased report says North Korea has evaded United Nations sanctions, providing Syria with materials for chemical weapons.
articles.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS — North Korea has been shipping supplies to the Syrian government that could be used in the production of chemical weapons, United Nations experts contend.
